newsitem.title: USA: NCAA BASKETBALL-ARIZONA CELEBRATES WITH RALLY AT FOOTBALL STADIUM.
newsitem.headline: NCAA BASKETBALL-ARIZONA CELEBRATES WITH RALLY AT FOOTBALL STADIUM.

text.p: The triumphant Arizona Wildcats returned home Tuesday to a rally drawing 40,000 frenzied fans to the school's football stadium to celebrate their first national college basketball championship.

The Arizona players, who beat defending champions Kentucky 84-79 in overtime Monday night at the RCA Dome in Indianapolis, were transported from the airport by motorcade to the football stadium for an hour-long rally.

The Wildcats capped a brilliant tournament run with their victory over Kentucky. Arizona, a club with only one senior, became the first team ever to vanquish three top seeds (Kansas, North Carolina and Kentucky) on the way to the title.
"I still have difficulty believing this has happened," said Arizona coach Lute Olson, who had also been to the Final Four in 1988 and 1994, but lost in the semifinals both times.
"We've had other teams, outstanding teams, more experienced teams."
Junior guard Miles Simon matched a career-high with 30 points in Monday's win and was named outstanding player of the tournament.
With the victory, Arizona finally buried its past NCAA Tournament failures, including first-round upset losses in 1992, 1993 and 1995.
Olson, who had suffered from a label as a coach who couldn't win "the big one," led his team to six Tournament victories, one seemingly more improbable than the last.

Teaming up with Simon to give Arizona an unbeatable backcourt combination was 19-year-old freshman Mike Bibby, who helped break the vaunted Kentucky fullcourt press and finished the championship final with 19 points and nine rebounds.
